definitions.definition: To make a short , audible inhalation , through the nose , as when smelling something.
examples: The dog sniffed around the park, searching for a nice scent.
I sniffed the meat to see whether it had gone off.

definitions.definition: To say (something) while sniffing, such as in case of illness or unhappiness , or in contempt .
examples: "He's never coming back, is he?" she sniffed while looking at a picture of him.

definitions.definition: To pry ; to investigate in an interfering manner.
To be dismissive or contemptuous of something; used with at .
examples: This opportunity is not to be sniffed at.

definitions.definition: To intercept and analyse packets of data being transmitted over a network .
To inhale drugs (usually cocaine ) through the nose , usually in powder form.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To make a short , audible inhalation , through the nose , as when smelling something.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To say (something) while sniffing, such as in case of illness or unhappiness , or in contempt .
( intransitive ) To pry ; to investigate in an interfering manner.
To be dismissive or contemptuous of something; used with at .
( computing ) To intercept and analyse packets of data being transmitted over a network .
( slang , chiefly UK ) To inhale drugs (usually cocaine ) through the nose , usually in powder form.
